content: frankie s knitted stuff woven stars these knitted stars are very quick to make and use tiny amounts of yarn knit them for yourself and your friends or sell them to raise money for your favourite charity yarn and needles i knitted my stars with stylecraft special dk 295 m / 100g on 3 25 mm needles us size 3 i used two shades of one colour for each star to emphasise the weaving it takes less than 5g in all to knit one star the finished stars measure about 9 cm / 3½ across their widest point you can use other weights of yarn for different sized stars just choose needles that will give you a fairly firm gauge you will also need a crochet hook to make the hanging chain i used a 3 5 mm hook the knitting each star is made up of two identical triangles the second one is woven through the first before being sewn together the triangles are knitted back and forth for only five row i told you they were quick using the long tail method cast on 63 stitches that s 21 stitches for each side of the triangle row 1 k9 s2kp2 k18 twice s2kp2 k9 57 sts row 2 k7 ssk sl 1 pwise wyif k2tog k14 twice ssk sl 1 pwise wyif k2tog k7 51 sts row 3 k7 s2kp2 k14 twice s2kp2 k7 45 sts row 4 k5 ssk p1 k2tog k10 twice ssk p1 k2tog k5 39 sts row 5 k5 s2kp2 k10 twice s2kp2 k5 33 sts as you can see you re decreasing six stitches every row two for each of the star s three points the right side of the knitting is that with the long knit stitches showing at the points now cast off following this pattern k3 ssk p1 k2tog k6 twice ssk p1 k2tog k3 with the right sides together oversew / whipstitch the two ends of the strip together to complete the triangle this join doesn t have to be invisible as it will be covered by the next part of the star knit a second triangle but don t sew it together yet leave a long tail when casting this one off the weaving this was difficult to photograph but easy enough to do take the end of the second triangle that doesn t have the long tail and thread it over and under each of the three sides of the first triangle in turn the pictures above show the first two sides being woven for the third side the one at the bottom of the picture you ll have to pull the knitting about a bit to get the two ends to meet make sure that you haven t twisted your strip and then close the triangle as before now ease the two triangles into a regular shape before using your tail of yarn to sew them together working on the wrong side of the star sew
